page.title: 18TRANSPORT & FARMING
page.content:
{KENT HOUSE CARRIAGES}
On the walls of Kent House Stables there were some orange blocks. Mr.Allan said they tasted like salt and the horses liked them. The big wheel on the carriages had oak spokes, ash felloes and the centre wheel was made out of elm. One of the carriages once carried Peggy Mount, an actress. The gypsy caravan had cupboards, a fireplace, a sink and a bed. {HEELEY CITY FARM} Sheffield has its very own farm. It is run by the City Council. It has almost one hundred animals including rabbits, guinea pigs and quails. At the farm children can work and ride the horses.{Everybody is welcome.
